snippet: Many in Washington are wondering how the General Services Administration could not have known that spending $822,000 on a luxury trip was going to cause an outcry.
abstract: Many in Washington are wondering how the General Services Administration could not have known that spending $822,000 on a luxury trip to Las Vegas in October 2010 was going to cause an outcry; Martha Johnson fires two GSA deputies and resigns as chief in wake of report.

byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

lead_paragraph: Many in Washington are wondering how the General Services Administration could not have known that spending $822,000 on a luxury trip was going to cause an outcry.

headline.seo: G.S.A. Las Vegas Trip Is the Talk of Washington
headline.main: Agency Trip to Las Vegas Is the Talk of Washington
headline.print_headline: Agency Trip to Las Vegas Is the Talk of Washington
